page.title: 191st Colwall Brownies
page.content: Twenty eight to ten year old girls and two leaders, Brown Owl and Tawny Owl, gather for two hours weekly to have a Brownie meeting. The aim is to encourage young girls to think of other people and to help the community, and to have fun whilst learning the principles of the Guiding Movement started by Lord Baden-Powell many years ago. A weekly subscription of 25p per Brownie is collected by the leader (sixer) of each small group. These groups are named Pixies, Elves, Imps and Gnomes. A circle is formed whilst singing the Brownie song and group discussion (Pow-wow) follows. Individual pocket books record their progress through the eight challenges. (1. Being wide awake 2. Keeping fit 3. Doing their best 4. Making things 5. Being friendly 6. Lending a hand
